title: Drawing, "Design for a Jardiniere", ca. 1855
medium: Graphite, brush and ink, watercolor, gouache, gold paint on tracing paper, laid down
inscribed: Inscribed in ink, lower center: No 639/Jardiniere ovale porcelaine et bronze long. 53c larg. 24c. haut. 26c. largeuer 24c.  Assiette ronde pour dessert.
creditline: Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund
description: The body of the jardiniere is of blue porcelain, with a central field containing a spray of roses against a light background, within a narrow gold frame.  Mounted on a bronze base, composed of scroll legs joined by swags. Bronze handles and enframements.  Flowers in the jardiniere.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Jardiniere", ca. 1855.
ca. 1855. Graphite, brush and ink, watercolor, gouache, gold paint on tracing paper, laid down. Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund. 1953-206-11.
